result.execSummary:
The defendant William B. Lasalle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant has 1 day credit if probation revoked.
Undergo any counseling/treatment/evaluation per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Commence on or before Aug. 9, 2015 unless agent states earlier
Consecutive to: to any other sentence/commitment

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William B. Lasalle in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant William B. Lasalle in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Both parties recv'd and reviewed revocation summary.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:
All costs unpaid to be civil judgment
90 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, concurrent
101 days credit
Paperwork handed in court
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 9, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant William B. Lasalle in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Victim makes statement.  State gives recommendation of probation or 60 days jail.  Atty. Tsai makes recomm. of 8 days jail.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
24 mos. probation
20 days SCJ, w/work release.  Commence on or before Aug. 9, 2015 @ 6 pm unless agent directs ealier
Undergo any counseling/evaluation per agent.
Absolute Sobriety of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription 
Report to agent any prescribed meds.
1 day credit if probation revoked
$543.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)  Bond to be applied
Paperwork handed in court.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states matters aren't resolved yet but offer was not accepted.  Requests plea/argued sentencing be set out.  Bonds continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Return date at 05-21-2015 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-08-2015 09:00 am.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Auth filed previously.  New charges pending in Sauk Co.  Request 3 week reset to further discuss. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Auth filed and approved.  Attorney Tsai request 2 weeks.  State does not object.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for William B. Lasalle
Current: 640 8th ST., Prairie du Sac, WI 53578 United States  (Effective: 03-09-2015)
Prior: 1006 Franklin Street, Sauk City, WI 53583

Pre-trial conference on March 27, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Return date on April 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant William B. Lasalle by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant William B. Lasalle in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Tsai responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $400.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/A.S. or her residence and absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  May return to residence one time upon prior notice and w/law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
